00149 typedef struct
00150 {
00151     uint32_t bufa;
00152     uint32_t bufb;
00153     uint32_t buf;
00154     uint32_t pos;
00155     uint32_t *tail;
00156     uint32_t *start;
00157     uint32_t length;
00158     uint32_t initpos;
00159 }
00160 Bitstream;
00161 
00162 /* initialise bitstream structure */
00163 static void __inline
00164 BitstreamInit(Bitstream * const bs,
00165                           void *const bitstream,
00166                           uint32_t length)
00167 {
00168         uint32_t tmp;
00169         uint32_t bitpos;
00170         ptr_t adjbitstream = (ptr_t)bitstream;
00171 
00172         /*
00173          * Start the stream on a uint32_t boundary, by rounding down to the
00174          * previous uint32_t and skipping the intervening bytes.
00175          */
00176         bitpos = (uint32_t)((sizeof(uint32_t)-1) & (size_t)bitstream);
00177         adjbitstream = adjbitstream - bitpos;
00178         bs->start = bs->tail = (uint32_t *) adjbitstream;
00179 
00180         tmp = *bs->start;
00181 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00182         BSWAP(tmp);
00183 #endif
00184         bs->bufa = tmp;
00185 
00186         tmp = *(bs->start + 1);
00187 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00188         BSWAP(tmp);
00189 #endif
00190         bs->bufb = tmp;
00191 
00192         bs->buf = 0;
00193         bs->pos = bs->initpos = bitpos*8;
00194         bs->length = length;
00195 }
00196 
00197 
00198 /* reset bitstream state */
00199 
00200 static void __inline
00201 BitstreamReset(Bitstream * const bs)
00202 {
00203         uint32_t tmp;
00204 
00205         bs->tail = bs->start;
00206 
00207         tmp = *bs->start;
00208 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00209         BSWAP(tmp);
00210 #endif
00211         bs->bufa = tmp;
00212 
00213         tmp = *(bs->start + 1);
00214 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00215         BSWAP(tmp);
00216 #endif
00217         bs->bufb = tmp;
00218 
00219         bs->buf = 0;
00220         bs->pos = bs->initpos;
00221 }

00223 
00224 /* reads n bits from bitstream without changing the stream pos */
00225 
00226 static uint32_t __inline
00227 BitstreamShowBits(Bitstream * const bs,
00228                                   const uint32_t bits)
00229 {
00230         int nbit = (bits + bs->pos) - 32;
00231 
00232         if (nbit > 0) {
00233                 return ((bs->bufa & (0xffffffff >> bs->pos)) << nbit) | (bs->
00234                                                                                                                                  bufb >> (32 -
00235                                                                                                                                                   nbit));
00236         } else {
00237                 return (bs->bufa & (0xffffffff >> bs->pos)) >> (32 - bs->pos - bits);
00238         }
00239 }
00240 
00241 
00242 /* skip n bits forward in bitstream */
00243 
00244 static __inline void
00245 BitstreamSkip(Bitstream * const bs,
00246                           const uint32_t bits)
00247 {
00248         bs->pos += bits;
00249 
00250         if (bs->pos >= 32) {
00251                 uint32_t tmp;
00252 
00253                 bs->bufa = bs->bufb;
00254                 tmp = *((uint32_t *) bs->tail + 2);
00255 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00256                 BSWAP(tmp);
00257 #endif
00258                 bs->bufb = tmp;
00259                 bs->tail++;
00260                 bs->pos -= 32;
00261         }
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 /* number of bits to next byte alignment */
00266 static __inline uint32_t
00267 BitstreamNumBitsToByteAlign(Bitstream *bs)
00268 {
00269         uint32_t n = (32 - bs->pos) % 8;
00270         return n == 0 ? 8 : n;
00271 }
00272 
00273 
00274 /* show nbits from next byte alignment */
00275 static __inline uint32_t
00276 BitstreamShowBitsFromByteAlign(Bitstream *bs, int bits)
00277 {
00278         int bspos = bs->pos + BitstreamNumBitsToByteAlign(bs);
00279         int nbit = (bits + bspos) - 32;
00280 
00281         if (bspos >= 32) {
00282                 return bs->bufb >> (32 - nbit);
00283         } else  if (nbit > 0) {
00284                 return ((bs->bufa & (0xffffffff >> bspos)) << nbit) | (bs->
00285                                                                                                                                  bufb >> (32 -
00286                                                                                                                                                   nbit));
00287         } else {
00288                 return (bs->bufa & (0xffffffff >> bspos)) >> (32 - bspos - bits);
00289         }
00290 
00291 }
00292 
00293 
00294 
00295 /* move forward to the next byte boundary */
00296 
00297 static __inline void
00298 BitstreamByteAlign(Bitstream * const bs)
00299 {
00300         uint32_t remainder = bs->pos % 8;
00301 
00302         if (remainder) {
00303                 BitstreamSkip(bs, 8 - remainder);
00304         }
00305 }
00306 
00307 
00308 /* bitstream length (unit bits) */
00309 
00310 static uint32_t __inline
00311 BitstreamPos(const Bitstream * const bs)
00312 {
00313         return((uint32_t)(8*((ptr_t)bs->tail - (ptr_t)bs->start) + bs->pos - bs->initpos));
00314 }
00315 
00316 static void __inline
00317 BitstreamFlush(Bitstream* const bs)
00318 {
00319     if (bs->pos) {
00320         uint32_t b = bs->buf;
00321 
00322 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00323         BSWAP(b);
00324 #endif
00325         *bs->tail = b;
00326     }
00327 }
00328 
00329 /*
00330  * flush the bitstream & return length (unit bytes)
00331  * NOTE: assumes no futher bitstream functions will be called.
00332  */
00333 
00334 static uint32_t __inline
00335 BitstreamLength(Bitstream * const bs)
00336 {
00337         uint32_t len = (uint32_t)((ptr_t)bs->tail - (ptr_t)bs->start);
00338 
00339     if (bs->pos)
00340         len += (bs->pos + 7) / 8;
00341         /* initpos is always on a byte boundary */
00342         if (bs->initpos)
00343                 len -= bs->initpos/8;
00344 
00345         return len;
00346 }
00347 
00348 
00349 /* move bitstream position forward by n bits and write out buffer if needed */
00350 
00351 static void __inline
00352 BitstreamForward(Bitstream * const bs,
00353                                  const uint32_t bits)
00354 {
00355         bs->pos += bits;
00356 
00357         if (bs->pos >= 32) {
00358                 uint32_t b = bs->buf;
00359 
00360 #ifndef ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
00361                 BSWAP(b);
00362 #endif
00363                 *bs->tail++ = b;
00364                 bs->buf = 0;
00365                 bs->pos -= 32;
00366         }
00367 }
00368 
00369 /* read n bits from bitstream */
00370 
00371 static uint32_t __inline
00372 BitstreamGetBits(Bitstream * const bs,
00373                                  const uint32_t n)
00374 {
00375         uint32_t ret = BitstreamShowBits(bs, n);
00376 
00377         BitstreamSkip(bs, n);
00378         return ret;
00379 }
00380 
00381 
00382 /* read single bit from bitstream */
00383 
00384 static uint32_t __inline
00385 BitstreamGetBit(Bitstream * const bs)
00386 {
00387         return BitstreamGetBits(bs, 1);
00388 }
00389 
00390 
00391 /* write single bit to bitstream */
00392 
00393 static void __inline
00394 BitstreamPutBit(Bitstream * const bs,
00395                                 const uint32_t bit)
00396 {
00397         if (bit)
00398                 bs->buf |= (0x80000000 >> bs->pos);
00399 
00400         BitstreamForward(bs, 1);
00401 }
00402 
00403 
00404 /* write n bits to bitstream */
00405 
00406 static void __inline
00407 BitstreamPutBits(Bitstream * const bs,
00408                                  const uint32_t value,
00409                                  const uint32_t size)
00410 {
00411         uint32_t shift = 32 - bs->pos - size;
00412 
00413         if (shift <= 32) {
00414                 bs->buf |= value << shift;
00415                 BitstreamForward(bs, size);
00416         } else {
00417                 uint32_t remainder;
00418 
00419                 shift = size - (32 - bs->pos);
00420                 bs->buf |= value >> shift;
00421                 BitstreamForward(bs, size - shift);
00422                 remainder = shift;
00423 
00424                 shift = 32 - shift;
00425 
00426                 bs->buf |= value << shift;
00427                 BitstreamForward(bs, remainder);
00428         }
00429 }
00430 
00431 static const int stuffing_codes[8] =
00432 {
00433                 /* nbits     stuffing code */
00434         0,              /* 1          0 */
00435         1,              /* 2          01 */
00436         3,              /* 3          011 */
00437         7,              /* 4          0111 */
00438         0xf,    /* 5          01111 */
00439         0x1f,   /* 6          011111 */
00440         0x3f,   /* 7          0111111 */
00441         0x7f,   /* 8          01111111 */
00442 };
00443 
00444 /* pad bitstream to the next byte boundary */
00445 
00446 static void __inline
00447 BitstreamPad(Bitstream * const bs)
00448 {
00449         int bits = 8 - (bs->pos % 8);
00450         if (bits < 8)
00451                 BitstreamPutBits(bs, stuffing_codes[bits - 1], bits);
00452 }
00453 
00454 
00455 /*
00456  * pad bitstream to the next byte boundary
00457  * alway pad: even if currently at the byte boundary
00458  */
00459 
00460 static void __inline
00461 BitstreamPadAlways(Bitstream * const bs)
00462 {
00463         int bits = 8 - (bs->pos % 8);
00464         BitstreamPutBits(bs, stuffing_codes[bits - 1], bits);
00465 }
00466 
00467 static void __inline
00468 BitstreamPadZero(Bitstream * const bs)
00469 {
00470     int bits = 8 - (bs->pos % 8);
00471     if (bits < 8)
00472         BitstreamPutBits(bs, 0, bits);
00473 }
00474 //for CABAC
00475 static void __inline
00476 BitstreamPadOneA(Bitstream * const bs)
00477 {
00478         int bits = 8 - (bs->pos % 8);
00479         if (bits<=8 && bits>0)
00480                 BitstreamPutBits(bs, 1<<(bits-1), bits);
00481 }
00482 static void __inline
00483 BitstreamPadOne(Bitstream * const bs)
00484 {
00485         int bits = 8 - (bs->pos % 8);
00486         if (bits<8 && bits>0)
00487                 BitstreamPutBits(bs, 1<<(bits-1), bits);
00488 }
00490 // exp-golomb
00491 static void __inline
00492 eg_write(Bitstream* const bs, int32_t code_num)
00493 {
00494     int32_t tmp = code_num + 1;
00495     int32_t m, info;
00496   
00497     if (code_num != 0)
00498     {
00499         m = 0;
00500        
00501         while (tmp)
00502         {
00503             tmp >>= 1;
00504             m ++;
00505         }
00506 
00507         m --;
00508         
00509         info = code_num + 1 - (1 << m);
00510         BitstreamPutBits(bs, 1, m + 1);
00511         BitstreamPutBits(bs, info, m);
00512     }
00513     else
00514     {
00515         BitstreamPutBits(bs, 1, 1);
00516     }
00517 }
00518 
00519 static int32_t __inline
00520 eg_read(Bitstream* const bs)
00521 {
00522     int32_t m, info;
00523     
00524     m = 0;
00525     
00526     while (!BitstreamGetBit(bs))
00527     {
00528         m ++;
00529     }
00530     
00531     if (m == 0)
00532         return 0;
00533 
00534     info = BitstreamGetBits(bs, m);
00535     
00536     return (1 << m) + info - 1;
00537 }
00538 
00539 #define eg_write_ue eg_write
00540 #define eg_read_ue eg_read
00541 #define eg_write_direct BitstreamPutBits
00542 #define eg_write_direct1 BitstreamPutBit
00543 #define eg_read_direct BitstreamGetBits
00544 #define eg_read_direct1 BitstreamGetBit
00545 #define eg_read_skip BitstreamSkip
00546 #define eg_show BitstreamShowBits
00547 #define eg_init BitstreamInit
00548 #define eg_align BitstreamPadZero
00549 #define bs_t Bitstream
00550 #define eg_len BitstreamLength
00551 #define eg_flush BitstreamFlush
00552 
00553 static void __inline
00554 eg_write_se(Bitstream* const bs, int32_t k)
00555 {
00556     int32_t code_num;
00557 
00558     code_num = (k > 0) ? (k << 1) - 1 : (-k) << 1;
00559 
00560     eg_write_ue(bs, code_num);    
00561 }
00562 
00563 static int32_t __inline
00564 eg_read_se(Bitstream* const bs)
00565 {
00566     int32_t k;
00567     int32_t code_num = eg_read_ue(bs);
00568     
00569     k = (code_num & 1) ? (code_num + 1) >> 1 : -(code_num >> 1);
00570     
00571     return k;
00572 }
00573 
00574 static void __inline
00575 eg_write_te(Bitstream* const bs, int32_t x, int32_t code_num)
00576 {
00577     x == 1 ? BitstreamPutBit(bs, !code_num) : eg_write_ue(bs, code_num);
00578 }
00579 
00580 static int32_t __inline
00581 eg_read_te(Bitstream* const bs, int32_t x)
00582 {
00583     return x == 1 ? (!BitstreamGetBit(bs)) : eg_read_ue(bs);
00584 }
00585 
00586 static uint32_t __inline
00587 eg_size_ue(Bitstream* const , int32_t code_num)
00588 {
00589     int32_t tmp = code_num + 1;
00590     int32_t m;
00591 
00592     if (code_num != 0)
00593     {
00594         m = 0;
00595 
00596         while (tmp)
00597         {
00598             tmp >>= 1;
00599             m ++;
00600         }
00601 
00602         m --;
00603 
00604         return m + m + 1;
00605     }
00606     else
00607     {
00608         return 1;
00609     }
00610 }
00611 
00612 static uint32_t __inline
00613 eg_size_se(Bitstream* const bs, int32_t k)
00614 {
00615     int32_t code_num;
00616 
00617     code_num = (k > 0) ? (k << 1) - 1 : (-k) << 1;
00618 
00619     return eg_size_ue(bs, code_num);    
00620 }
00621 
00622 static uint32_t __inline
00623 eg_size_te(Bitstream* const bs, int32_t x, int32_t k)
00624 {
00625     if (x > 0)
00626     {
00627         if (x == 1)
00628             return 1;
00629 
00630         return eg_size_ue(bs, k);
00631     }
00632     
00633     return 0;
00634 }
